dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: (mouth full of food) Yes?

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: (takes a sip of coffee) I want to be with you.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: I need to be with you. I want to leave my wife.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: Really? Michael, that’s a big decision. I don’t --

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: No no no, it’s something I have to do. I mean, if you’re interested.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: I mean, yeah. I mean it’s awfully sudden. I mean, I don’t want to be responsible for breaking up a marriage. Do we need to decide now?

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: It’s been years since I’ve felt anything like this. It’s like a floodgate has opened. I can’t close it. I don’t want to. I love you.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: (pause) Okay. Um, I don’t know. It seems so big and... Oh gosh, okay. Yeah, let’s do it.  Anomalisa ---Final Shoot_ v4 Rev. 10/4/15 59.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: Great! This is so great! (mouth full of food) Anomalisa. So I'll, I’1l call Donna and tell her. No, maybe I should go see her. Right?

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: (mouth full of food) Yeah, that sounds right. I think it’s such an important --

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: Could you not...You’re clicking your fork against your teeth. Could you not do that?

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: Oh, sorry. People have told me that before. I know, it’s a stupid unconscious habit.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: It’s okay. Anyway, you were saying?

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: Just that I think it’s more respectful. And you need to speak to Henry. And explain that this isn’t about him.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: But it is. It’s about him, too.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: Oh. Well, don’t tell him that. He’s just a little boy.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: Yeah. You're right. You’re being a little controlling, don’t you think?

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: I don’t mean to. I’m sorry.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: No, that’s okay.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: Good, I’m glad.  Anomalisa ---Final Shoot_ v4 Rev. 10/4/15 60. Lisa hums

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: Please don’t talk with food hanging out of your mouth.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: Oh, sorry. I’ma pig. Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: No, no. It’s okay. So, will you live in Los Angeles? Or do you need to stay in Ohio?

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: (mouth full of food) Um, I’m sorry. Hold on. (pause) as she chews her food.

dialogues.speaker: LISA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I could move to Los Angeles. I could do that.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: Good. As Lisa speaks, Lisa #2 joins her in perfect synchronizat but very quietly. It’s start almost inaudibly, but as it continues through their dialogue, Lisa #2’s voice gets progressively louder and Lisa’s voice gets progressively quiet. By the end of the scene, only Lisa #2 can be heard

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: We should go to the zoo today after your speech. I hear it’s really good. They have --

dialogues.speaker: LISA AND LISA
dialogues.text: -- breeding programs for all these endangered species.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: I’m sorry what did you say?

dialogues.speaker: LISA AND LISA
dialogues.text: Oh, they have breeding programs for all these endangered species, so you get to see things like pandas, which I think are awfully cute. They’re not really bears, I read.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: (distracted) Yeah, sure. That sounds fine.  Anomalisa ---Final Shoot_ v4 Rev. 10/4/15 61.

dialogues.speaker: LISA AND LISA
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: Nothing. The zoo sounds good. My stomach hurts. It feels empty. It’s clenched.

dialogues.speaker: LISA AND LISA
dialogues.text: Oh. Eat some more waffle maybe? Did I do something wrong? I’m sorry. Darling.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: It’s okay. I’m anxious about my speech, I suppose.

dialogues.speaker: LISA AND LISA
dialogues.text: Of course. Well, we’ll have fun after. We don’t have to go to the zoo. We can just hang out here. I have the whole weekend till I have to get back to work.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: That’s great.

dialogues.speaker: LISA AND LISA
dialogues.text: I’m so happy, Michael. I’ve waited for someone like you my whole life.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: I've waited too. We’1ll work it all out, right?

dialogues.speaker: LISA AND LISA
dialogues.text: Yes. Who would've thunk it? It’s just so beautiful. Life can be. Things can work out. That’s the lesson.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: Sometimes there’s no lesson. That’s a lesson in itself.

dialogues.speaker: LISA AND LISA
dialogues.text: I guess so. (pause) I feel anxious, Michael. I feel something. Like you’re different-— acting.  Anomalisa ---Final Shoot_ v4 Rev. 10/4/15 62.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: Me? No, no, no. Everything’s fine. I’m just...

dialogues.speaker: LISA AND LISA
dialogues.text: I know (sigh) I’m not great to look at in bright sunlight.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: No, you’re very pretty.

dialogues.speaker: LISA AND LISA
dialogues.text: Okay. So, we could maybe go for a walk and talk or something.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: So I'll see you after?

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: Of course.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: -- and always remember, the customer is an individual. Just like you. Each person you speak to has had a day. Some of their days have been good, some bad, but they’ve all of them have had one. Each person you speak to has had a childhood. Each has a body. Each body has aches. What is it to be human? What is it to ache? What is it to be alive? I don’t know. What is it to ache? I don’t know. What is it to be alive? I don’t know. Uh, yes. How do I talk toa customer? How do I talk toa customer? These are the important questions for a customer service representative. What do I say? Do I smile while I’m on the phone? They can tell if you’re smiling even if they can’t see you. Did you know that? Try it as an experiment when you’re on the phone with a friend... Try it, go ahead. See, watch. (pause) I’m lost. You see I was smiling when I said that. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anomalisa ---Final Shoot_ v4 Rev. 10/4/15

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’ve lost my love. She’s an unmoored ship drifting off to sea. And I have no one to talk to. I have no one to talk to. I have no one to talk to. I’m sorry. I don’t mean to burden you with that. I just don’t know what else to do because I have no one to talk to. Be friendly to the customer. Think of the customer as your friend. I want to cry but I can’t. Is it the Zoloft, Dr. Horowitz? Is it the Zoloft... My face squeezes into that crying contortion you all know so well but nothing comes out. I need tears. It’s like not being able to come. I need tears to tear me in two and let this nightmare escape. Oh, um, anyway yes don’t forget to smile. It makes a person’s day. And what does it cost you? A smile is free. This is not working. This is not working. This is not working. The world is falling apart. The president is a war criminal.

dialogues.speaker: AUDIENCE
dialogues.text: Boo! Boo!

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: America is going down the tubes and you're talking about goddamn intelligent design. They’ve intentionally destroyed the public education system. It’s easier to manipulate dumb workers and soldiers.

dialogues.speaker: AUDIENCE
dialogues.text: There’s no need for that! Support out troops!

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: Eh? Oh, uh, yes, ah. Be personable. Remember to believe in yourself. Believe in your company. And your products or services. I sweat onto my pillow every night. I think something is very, very wrong with me. Be friendly. Yes, what does it cost you? Look for what is special about each individual. (MORE )
Anomalisa ---Final Shoot_ v4 Rev. 10/4/15 64.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Focus on that during your conversation. Our time here is limited. We forget that. Death comes, that’s it. Soon it’s as if we never existed. So remember to smile. Remember there is someone out there for everyone. Someone to love. Remember every person you speak to needs love. Remember to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plane taking off. INT. MICHAEL’S HOUSE A door opens. Michael enters. Henry runs towards Michael.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Daddy! Daddy! Daddy!

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: Slugger. Henry jumps in Michael’s arms.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: What’d you bring me?

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: In the bag.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Lemme look! Lemme look! Henry jumps from Michael’s arms. Michael sets down his suitcase and bag.

dialogues.speaker: DONNA
dialogues.text: (chuckling) He gets right to the point.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: Hi, honey. Michael and Donna kiss.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Is this it?

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: Yup.  Anomalisa ---Final Shoot_ v4 Rev. 10/4/15 65.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: A toy. The heavy plastic package is struggled with.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: It’s a doll. It’s for girls. It’s a girls doll.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: No. It’s a toy an antique it moves.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: It’s stupid, it’s stupid and the face is broken.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: It’s an antique, Slugger. That’s a part of its charm.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: I don’t get it. What are all these...these words here?

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: I don’t know. It’s in Japanese. Press some buttons. It moves. Buttons are pressed. Tinny music starts. Cheap gears whir It continues throughout, getting louder and more complica

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: What else did you get me?

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: Well, I didn’t get you anything--

dialogues.speaker: MANY VOICES
dialogues.text: Surprise! (singing) For he’s a jolly good fellow...

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: Oh, Jesus. That scared me.

dialogues.speaker: DONNA
dialogues.text: Welcome home, honey! It’s a surprise party!  Anomalisa ---Final Shoot_ v4 Rev. 10/4/15 66.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: I don’t -- Who are all these people?

dialogues.speaker: EVERYBODY
dialogues.text: (ad-libbed welcome home Michael, good to see you)

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: Oh, thanks. Who are they?

dialogues.speaker: DONNA
dialogues.text: It’s everybody, honey!

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: What’s it doing now, Daddy?

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: I don’t recognize any of them.

dialogues.speaker: EVERYBODY
dialogues.text: Michael, how are you?

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: Oh yeah, yeah, how are you?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Daddy, what’s coming out of the toy?

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: I don’t know.

dialogues.speaker: DONNA
dialogues.text: God Michael, it looks like semen.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: I don’t know. I just got it ata store. I don’t know.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: What’s semen, Mommy?

dialogues.speaker: DONNA
dialogues.text: Oh, it’s just a liquid Henry. It’s a liquid. Michael don’t you realize that we love. Henry, me, all of us here.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: Who are you, Donna? Who are you really?  Anomalisa ---Final Shoot_ v4 Rev. 10/4/15 67.

dialogues.speaker: DONNA
dialogues.text: Oh for fuck’s sake. I’m sorry, Henry. Mommy said a bad word. For fuck’s sake, Michael. I don’t know who I am, I mean. Who are you? Who is anyone? Who could answer that question? I don’t want you to leave.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: Donna, I’m not leaving.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Is Daddy’s leaving?

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: (pause) Of course not, slugger. Where would I go?

dialogues.speaker: PARTY GOER
dialogues.text: Ha-ah, well. Good to see you.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: Thanks very much. Momotaro San song comes from the toy.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: (pause) Daddy, what’s it doing now?

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: Singing Slugger.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Oh. Oh. Um, can I go out and play?

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: Yeah, sure. I’11 stay here and listen to it till it’s over. After a bit the noise fades. There is just the distant so of the wind.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: September 16th, 2005. Dear Michael, I’m sorry to see you go but I understand.

dialogues.speaker: LISA AND LISA
dialogues.text: Well I don’t understand but I accept it.  Anomalisa ---Final Shoot_ v4 Rev. 10/4/15 68.

dialogues.speaker: LISA AND LISA
dialogues.text: I’m so glad we had this time together.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: I don’t think I ever felt love like this, was. (pause) Maybe someday we'll meet again under better circumstances. Love, Lisa “Anomalisa” Hesselman. P.S. I looked up Anomarisa in my Japanese English dictionary. It turns out it means Goddess of Heaven. Not that I think of myself that way, of course. It’s just, interesting. Fade to black.
